For common etiological agents causing cellulitis, see Annexure B.9.3 
Additional Information:  
• 
Bacteria causing infection below the skin surface leading to an acute superficial infection 
affecting the deep dermis and subcutaneous tissue is cellulitis. Cellulitis is relatively common, 
and most often occurs in middle-aged and older adults. 
Reference:

Guidelines for the Diagnosis and Management of Skin and Soft Tissue Infections: 2014 Update by the 
Infectious Diseases Society of America, Clinical Infectious Diseases, Volume 59, Issue 2, 15 July 2014, 
Pages e10–e52, https://doi.org/10.1093/cid/ciu296
